title: Did RFK jr claim heroin made him a class topper? Here's the actual fact
content: ​"I was at the bottom of my class. I started doing heroin, and I went to the top of my class. Suddenly I could sit still, and I could read and I could concentrate. I could listen to what people were saying," Kennedy Jr said in a July video which is now doing the rounds after he was nominated as the health secretary of the incoming Donald Trump administration.
summary: ​"I was at the bottom of my class. I started doing heroin, and I went to the top of my class. Suddenly I could sit still, and I could read and I could concentrate. I could listen to what people were saying," Kennedy Jr said in a July video which is now doing the rounds after he was nominated as the health secretary of the incoming Donald Trump administration.

title: Massachusetts farmers anticipate record cranberry harvest despite climate challenges
content: Massachusetts cranberry farmers are experiencing a bountiful harvest this year, with projections exceeding 2 million barrels. Steve Ward, a local grower, anticipates his best yield in three years despite challenges like hot weather and dry spells impacting cranberry plants. While the industry faces historical hurdles such as trade wars and fluctuating prices, farmers are innovating with solar energy solutions.
summary: Massachusetts cranberry farmers are experiencing a bountiful harvest this year, with projections exceeding 2 million barrels. Steve Ward, a local grower, anticipates his best yield in three years despite challenges like hot weather and dry spells impacting cranberry plants. While the industry faces historical hurdles such as trade wars and fluctuating prices, farmers are innovating with solar energy solutions.

title: Does DEI training make people 'anti-Hindu'? What you ought to know
content: A study by the Network Contagion Research Institute (NCRI) and Rutgers University highlights unintended consequences of caste-based Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) programs by Equality Labs. It found that such training exacerbates anti-Hindu bias, fosters divisive rhetoric, and increases perceptions of systemic injustice.
summary: A study by the Network Contagion Research Institute (NCRI) and Rutgers University highlights unintended consequences of caste-based Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) programs by Equality Labs. It found that such training exacerbates anti-Hindu bias, fosters divisive rhetoric, and increases perceptions of systemic injustice.

title: USA Facing Bankruptcy: Why every American is already $100,000 in debt
content: As debt climbs, the US government is spending over $1 billion daily on interest payments alone. This year, servicing the debt is expected to exceed $1 trillion—more than what is allocated for national defence. Rising interest rates compound the problem, increasing borrowing costs for both the government and ordinary citizens.Shai Akabas, from the Bipartisan Policy Center, explained: “The current level of debt is driving up interest rates, including mortgages, and raising living costs for households. This will dampen economic growth and reduce opportunities for future generations.”
summary: As debt climbs, the US government is spending over $1 billion daily on interest payments alone. This year, servicing the debt is expected to exceed $1 trillion—more than what is allocated for national defence. Rising interest rates compound the problem, increasing borrowing costs for both the government and ordinary citizens.Shai Akabas, from the Bipartisan Policy Center, explained: “The current level of debt is driving up interest rates, including mortgages, and raising living costs for households. This will dampen economic growth and reduce opportunities for future generations.”

title: New twist in DB Cooper Case: Was DB Cooper actually Richard McCoy?
content: Fast forward to 2023, when Chanté and Rick claimed that their father was the elusive hijacker. They waited until their mother’s death in 2020 to share their story, citing fears that she could be implicated due to evidence allegedly linking her to the crime. Among the items they revealed was a parachute that Rick claimed was “one in a billion” and matched the rig prepared by skydiving expert Earl Cossey, who had modified the parachutes for Cooper. The parachute was reportedly found in their mother’s storage outside the family home.
summary: Fast forward to 2023, when Chanté and Rick claimed that their father was the elusive hijacker. They waited until their mother’s death in 2020 to share their story, citing fears that she could be implicated due to evidence allegedly linking her to the crime. Among the items they revealed was a parachute that Rick claimed was “one in a billion” and matched the rig prepared by skydiving expert Earl Cossey, who had modified the parachutes for Cooper. The parachute was reportedly found in their mother’s storage outside the family home.

title: Jimmy Kimmel jokes Trump's 25% tariff is dumbest idea he's come up with since Don Jr
content: Jimmy Kimmel mocked Donald Trump's proposed 25% tariff on Mexican and Canadian imports, calling it his "dumbest idea." Kimmel said the tariff will send inflation through the roof because it's not Mexico, Canada, China that pay the taxes but the American companies that import their products pay the taxes making avocados $40.
summary: Jimmy Kimmel mocked Donald Trump's proposed 25% tariff on Mexican and Canadian imports, calling it his "dumbest idea."  Kimmel said the tariff will send inflation through the roof because it's not Mexico, Canada, China that pay the taxes but the American companies that import their products pay the taxes making avocados $40.

title: Elon Musk's mother predicts how long his son's friendship with Donald Trump will last
content: Maye Musk, Elon's mother, said the media will try to break the relationship between Elon Musk and Donald Trump. ​"First of all, what they call the mainstream media but I call them dishonest Democrat media, they will be trying to break up the relationship. They will be hating everything. I told that to Elon and he said he expects it," Maye Musk said.
summary: Maye Musk, Elon's mother, said the media will try to break the relationship between Elon Musk and Donald Trump. ​"First of all, what they call the mainstream media but I call them dishonest Democrat media, they will be trying to break up the relationship. They will be hating everything. I told that to Elon and he said he expects it," Maye Musk said.

title: Kamala Harris called a 'functioning alcoholic', 'broken' as she drops new video
content: As Kamala Harris consoled her supporters in a new video, social media users said Trump's victory has completely broken her and she has possibly gone back to her day-drinking. ​Kamala Haris and Doug Emhoff went to Hawaii for a vacation and the vice president reportedly dropped hints of staying in the race. According to a politico report, Kamala Harris told her allies to keep her options open for the California governor race or the 2028 presidential race.
summary: As Kamala Harris consoled her supporters in a new video, social media users said Trump's victory has completely broken her and she has possibly gone back to her day-drinking. ​Kamala Haris and Doug Emhoff went to Hawaii for a vacation and the vice president reportedly dropped hints of staying in the race. According to a politico report, Kamala Harris told her allies to keep her options open for the California governor race or the 2028 presidential race.

title: Former Conservative leader William Hague appointed Oxford University chancellor
Why Elon Musk is being trolled for his take on F-35 fighters
content: Mauro Gilli, a senior researcher in military technology at the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology (ETH Zurich), responded to Musk’s claims, pointing out the complexities of defence technology."What makes the F-35 or the B-21 expensive is the software and electronics, not the pilot per se ... which is important because a reusable drone would need to get all that flashy electronics of an F-35, which is expensive," Gilli wrote on X.
summary: Mauro Gilli, a senior researcher in military technology at the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology (ETH Zurich), responded to Musk’s claims, pointing out the complexities of defence technology."What makes the F-35 or the B-21 expensive is the software and electronics, not the pilot per se ... which is important because a reusable drone would need to get all that flashy electronics of an F-35, which is expensive," Gilli wrote on X.

title: Prince Harry, Meghan Markle to fight deportation attempts by Trump: Report
content: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are prepared to fight potential deportation threats from President-elect Donald Trump. The couple intends to remain in California, where they feel at home and have established roots. Harry's past drug use admissions have raised visa concerns, adding to the uncertainty surrounding their future in the US.
summary: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are prepared to fight potential deportation threats from President-elect Donald Trump.  The couple intends to remain in California, where they feel at home and have established roots. Harry's past drug use admissions have raised visa concerns, adding to the uncertainty surrounding their future in the US.

title: Nasa discovers hidden Cold War-era 'secret city' beneath Greenland's ice sheet
content: A Nasa survey unearthed Camp Century, a hidden Cold War-era US military base beneath Greenland's ice. Built in the 1960s for Project Iceworm, the base was intended to house nuclear missiles aimed at the Soviet Union. Abandoned in 1967, its rediscovery raises concerns about thawing ice exposing hazardous materials.
summary: A Nasa survey unearthed Camp Century, a hidden Cold War-era US military base beneath Greenland's ice. Built in the 1960s for Project Iceworm, the base was intended to house nuclear missiles aimed at the Soviet Union. Abandoned in 1967, its rediscovery raises concerns about thawing ice exposing hazardous materials.

title: Why Joe Rogan wants Bill Gates to get 'six-pack abs'
content: Rogan remarked, "Bill Gates should get jacked. He's got a lot of money. He should get a trainer." Andreessen chimed in, suggesting that Gates adopting a more athletic physique would "be extremely helpful for when he goes on his book tour and talks about public health." Rogan took it further, saying, "If Bill Gates has a six-pack, I'd listen to him."
summary: Rogan remarked, "Bill Gates should get jacked. He's got a lot of money. He should get a trainer." Andreessen chimed in, suggesting that Gates adopting a more athletic physique would "be extremely helpful for when he goes on his book tour and talks about public health." Rogan took it further, saying, "If Bill Gates has a six-pack, I'd listen to him."

title: 2 opposition figures killed as Tanzania holds election: Party
ISKCON urges Bangladesh government to ensure 'peaceful coexistence' for Hindus after Chinmoy Krishna Das' arrest
content: ISKCON Bangladesh condemned the arrest of Hindu leader Chinmoy Krishna Das and subsequent violence against the Sanatani community. They urged the interim government to protect religious freedoms and ensure justice for Das, a vocal advocate for minority rights. Over 200 attacks on Hindus have been reported since August 5, prompting concern from India.
summary: ISKCON Bangladesh condemned the arrest of Hindu leader Chinmoy Krishna Das and subsequent violence against the Sanatani community.  They urged the interim government to protect religious freedoms and ensure justice for Das, a vocal advocate for minority rights.  Over 200 attacks on Hindus have been reported since August 5, prompting concern from India.

title: Georgia's governing party picks former soccer player as presidential candidate
content: Georgia's ruling party, Georgian Dream, nominated ex-soccer star Mikheil Kavelashvili for president amidst post-election controversy. The opposition boycotts parliament, alleging a rigged vote influenced by Russia. Kavelashvili, a former Manchester City player and author of controversial legislation, is expected to win the largely ceremonial role given the ruling party's control.
summary: Georgia's ruling party, Georgian Dream, nominated ex-soccer star Mikheil Kavelashvili for president amidst post-election controversy. The opposition boycotts parliament, alleging a rigged vote influenced by Russia. Kavelashvili, a former Manchester City player and author of controversial legislation, is expected to win the largely ceremonial role given the ruling party's control.

title: ICC prosecutor seeks arrest warrant for Myanmar's military leader over crimes against Rohingya Muslim minority
content: The International Criminal Court (ICC) seeks an arrest warrant for Myanmar's military chief, Min Aung Hlaing, over atrocities against the Rohingya Muslim minority. Hlaing, who orchestrated the 2021 coup, faces accusations of crimes against humanity, including deportation and persecution. Nearly a million Rohingya fled to Bangladesh amidst a brutal campaign of ethnic cleansing.
summary: The International Criminal Court (ICC) seeks an arrest warrant for Myanmar's military chief, Min Aung Hlaing, over atrocities against the Rohingya Muslim minority. Hlaing, who orchestrated the 2021 coup, faces accusations of crimes against humanity, including deportation and persecution. Nearly a million Rohingya fled to Bangladesh amidst a brutal campaign of ethnic cleansing.

title: Who is John Phelan? Trump's mega donor with no military experience set to head US Navy
content: President-elect Trump has nominated John Phelan, a prominent Republican donor with no military background, as Secretary of the Navy. Trump lauded Phelan's business acumen, while critics noted the unusual choice. The nomination awaits Senate confirmation. Trump and Phelan aim to remove "wokeness" from the military, prioritizing traditional values over diversity initiatives.
summary: President-elect Trump has nominated John Phelan, a prominent Republican donor with no military background, as Secretary of the Navy.  Trump lauded Phelan's business acumen, while critics noted the unusual choice.  The nomination awaits Senate confirmation. Trump and Phelan aim to remove "wokeness" from the military, prioritizing traditional values over diversity initiatives.

title: Kamala Harris presidential campaign hit a roadblock when internet show 'Hot Ones' declined interview request
content: Kamala Harris's presidential campaign faced difficulties connecting with non-political audiences. Popular platforms like "Hot Ones" declined interview requests, citing a no-politics policy. While Donald Trump engaged with shows like "The Joe Rogan Experience" and others, Harris's team struggled to secure similar opportunities, hindering their outreach efforts and potentially contributing to their election loss.
summary: Kamala Harris's presidential campaign faced difficulties connecting with non-political audiences.  Popular platforms like "Hot Ones" declined interview requests, citing a no-politics policy.  While Donald Trump engaged with shows like "The Joe Rogan Experience" and others, Harris's team struggled to secure similar opportunities, hindering their outreach efforts and potentially contributing to their election loss.

title: Trump unveils key picks for his second term: John Phelan, Kevin Hassett, and Vince Haley appointed to top roles
content: President-elect Donald Trump announced key appointments for his upcoming administration. Businessman John Phelan will lead the Navy, economist Kevin Hassett will chair the National Economic Council, and speechwriter Vince Haley will head the Domestic Policy Council. These choices signal Trump's focus on his "America First" agenda and reliance on trusted allies.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump announced key appointments for his upcoming administration.  Businessman John Phelan will lead the Navy, economist Kevin Hassett will chair the National Economic Council, and speechwriter Vince Haley will head the Domestic Policy Council. These choices signal Trump's focus on his "America First" agenda and reliance on trusted allies.
